thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: Murray State picked an Ohio Valley Conference basketball favorite
thread.title_full: Murray State picked an Ohio Valley Conference basketball favorite

author: courier-journal.com
title: Murray State picked an Ohio Valley Conference basketball favorite
text:
Murray State's basketball team lost four starters, including an NBA draft pick, from last year's Ohio Valley Conference regular-season team. Still, the Racers were on Tuesday made a 2015-2016 OVC favorite.
Picked atop the West Division, Murray will also feature new head coach Matt McMahon, a former assistant who replaced Steve Prohm, now at Iowa State.
Belmont earned favoritism in the East Division as well as the nod for overall preseason favorite.
Also in the East are projected No. 2 Morehead State and Eastern Kentucky, No. 3 and also with new coach Dan McHale.
Murray State will have to replace, among others, point guard Cameron Payne, who the Oklahoma City Thunder selected in the NBA draft lottery. The Racers landed Jeffery Moss on the preseason All-OVC team and welcome Texas transfer Damarcus Croaker.
Murray went 29-6 last season but fell off the NCAA tournament bubble with a loss to Belmont in the OVC tournament.
PRESEASON OVC COACHES POLL
Overall champion: Belmont East Division 1. Belmont (22 first-place votes) – 132 points 2. Morehead State (1) – 105 3. Eastern Kentucky – 88 4. Tennessee Tech – 67 5. Jacksonville State – 52 6. Tennessee State - 48 West Division 1. Murray State (15 first-place vote) – 125 points 2. UT Martin (9) – 115 3. Eastern Illinois - 88 4. Southeast Missouri - 72 5. Austin Peay - 57 6. SIUE - 35
Preseason All-OVC Team
Alex Anderson, UT Martin Trae Anderson, Eastern Illinois Brent Arrington, Morehead State Craig Bradshaw, Belmont Evan Bradds, Belmont Antonius Cleveland, Southeast Missouri Chris Horton, Austin Peay Twymond Howard, UT Martin Cornell Johnston, Eastern Illinois Jeffery Moss, Murray State
